item.title: Projects
item.description: Personal Project 2014-2016 State, Empire and Commonwealth: International Thought in the Late Eighteenth-century Britain Kakenhi [Grant-in-Aid for Scientific Research in Japan] This study considers discourse on international sphere in the late eighteenth-century Britain, especially in terms of state, empire and commonwealth.

item.title: Publications
item.description: Articles & Chapters The Eloquence in Wartime: Mackintosh on Burke’s Letters on a Regicide Peace [in Japanese] Seisaku Kagaku [Policy Science] (Ritsumeikan University Policy Science Association), 2021.

item.title: Hello world
item.description: This is my first post! I launched the website on 1st April, 2021.

item.title: About me
item.description: Biography I am an intellectual historian of early modern ideas, in Kyoto, Japan. I completed my PhD at the Graduate School of Policy Science, Ritsumeikan University in 2009, during which time I was supervised by Tamihiro Shigemori.
